Class Circle

java.lang.Object
  GeometricShape
      Circle
All Implemented Interfaces:
AnotherComparable, Comparable, Nearable
public class Circle
extends GeometricShape

A Circle object has a radius that is valid. Perimeter and area can be calculated. Comparable's method compareTo compares two radii.

Version:
October 23, 2016
Author:
Alex Yu

compareTo

public int compareTo(Object obj)
Compares the current Circle with the Object obj.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable
Specified by:
compareTo in class GeometricShape
Parameters:
obj - the Circle object with which to compare
Returns:
0 if the two Circles have the same radii within an EPSILON, which is defined in GeometricShape > 0 if "this" radius is greater than the obj's radius < 0 if "this" radius is less than the obj's radius -999 if obj is not a Circle

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Tests if the two Circles have radii that are equal within an EPSILON, which is defined in GeometricShape.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
obj - Circle object to test if its radius is "nearly equal" to "this" radius
Returns:
true if the radii have "nearly equal" lengths; otherwise, false
